Module wgu.c195.schedulingsystem
Package wgu.c195.schedulingsystem.controllers

Class CRUDController

java.lang.Object
wgu.c195.schedulingsystem.controllers.GenericController
wgu.c195.schedulingsystem.controllers.CRUDController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class CRUDController extends GenericController implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
CRUDController. Create-Update-Delete Customers and Appointments. Main form for the majority of tasks this project requires.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resources)
      Main initialize function to populate everything upon logging in. Takes callback parameters and launches automatically upon form open. Also calls a function to display a 15 minute meeting warning upon logging in. lambda - This function uses lambda expressions to initialize selection listeners on the TableView elements, updating a global variable with the currently selected item and automatically populating the text fields with the selected element's information.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
      resources - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.

    • initCustomers

      public void initCustomers() throws SQLException
      lambda - This function uses lambda expressions to take a given CellValueFactory value and extract out an appropriate string for display purposes. Converts a Customer Division code into the appropriate Division name, and a Customer Country code into the appropriate Country. Initialize Customers TableView with database records.
      Throws:
      SQLException - Thrown if the database couldn't be accessed.

    • initAppointments

      public void initAppointments(String filter) throws SQLException
      Initialize Appointments TableView with database records.
      Parameters:
      filter - Takes a string ("all", "week", "month") and provides appointment filtering via SQL Statement modification.
      Throws:
      SQLException - Thrown if the database couldn't be accessed.

    • doUpdateCustomer

      public void doUpdateCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws SQLException
      Update a customer using data in the customer text fields, then call DBQuery to update the database.
      Parameters:
      event - Callback event upon clicking Update button.
      Throws:
      SQLException - Thrown if the database couldn't be accessed.

    • doDeleteCustomer

      public void doDeleteCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws SQLException
      Called upon clicking Delete customer button. Finds the currently selected Customer and tries to delete it. Then calls DBQuery to update the database.
      Parameters:
      event - Callback event upon clicking Delete button.
      Throws:
      SQLException - Thrown if the database couldn't be accessed.

    • doAddAppointment

      public void doAddAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws SQLException
      Build a new appointment using the Appointment Text Fields. Performs logical checks and validations before valling DBQuery to perform the database action.
      Parameters:
      event - Callback upon clicking add button.
      Throws:
      SQLException - Thrown if the database couldn't be accessed.

    • doUpdateAppointment

      public void doUpdateAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws SQLException
      Called upon clicking update Appointment button. Builds an Appointment from text boxes and then calls DBQuery to perform database actions.
      Parameters:
      event - Callback upon clicking update appointment.
      Throws:
      SQLException - Thrown if the database couldn't be accessed.

      public boolean validate(Appointment newAppt) throws SQLException

      Returns:
      True or false based on success or fail condition.

      SQLException - Thrown if the database couldn't be accessed.

    • outsideBusinessHours

      public boolean outsideBusinessHours(Appointment a)
      Validation function to check if the given appointment falls outside EST business hours.
      Parameters:
      a - Appointment to be checked for validity.
      Returns:
      True or false based on success condition.

    • overlapsExisting

      public boolean overlapsExisting(Appointment a) throws SQLException
      Validation function to check if the given appointment overlaps an existing appointment for this Customer.
      Parameters:
      a - Appointment to be checked.
      Returns:
      True or false based on success condition.
      Throws:
      SQLException - Thrown if the database couldn't be accessed.

    • timesOverlapping

      public boolean timesOverlapping(LocalDateTime a_start, LocalDateTime a_end, LocalDateTime b_start, LocalDateTime b_end)
      Helper function to consolidate logic regarding 2 overlapping periods of time.
      Parameters:
      a_start - First period start time.
      a_end - First period end time.
      b_start - Second period start time.
      b_end - Second period end time.
      Returns:
      True or false based on success condition.

    • display15minAlert

      public void display15minAlert(String name) throws SQLException

      Parameters:
      name - User to check for an upcoming appointment.
      Throws:
      SQLException - Thrown if the database couldn't be accessed.

    • doDeleteAppointment

      public void doDeleteAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws SQLException
      Called upon clicking delete appointment. Calls DBQuery to perform the database action, then displays an appropriate message.
      Parameters:
      event - Callback method called after clicking delete appointment.
      Throws:
      SQLException - Thrown if the database couldn't be accessed.
